alert.note: Alert for Ceiba; Humacao; Las Piedras; Naguabo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 5:15PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following counties, Ceiba, Humacao, Las Piedras and Naguabo. * WHEN...Until 715 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Naguabo, Humacao, Las Piedras, Ceiba, Anton Ruiz, Punta Santiago, La Fermina, Aguas Claras, Roosevelt Roads, Rio Blanco, Bajandas, Pena Pobre, Duque, Pueblito Del Rio, Daguao and Candelero Arriba. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
